result.execSummary:
The defendant William Edward Giese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Restitution Hearing scheduled for 07/01/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-4
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08/14/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-4

miscConds.notes:
**07/01/15- Mel Flanagan**
Court set restitution at $379.26 - payable to Tracy G. 
Restitution to be paid before payment on the costs, fees and assessments and surcharges, during the term of probation. Failure to pay is civil judgment.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's, during period of probation or civil judgment.
- No firearms/weapons. 48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming now attending.
- Attend and complete parenting classes. Class done, can be repeated if appropriate.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, Tracy G., without prior Court approval.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA & SENTENCING commencing 5/22/2015 received and filed. (57 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Tracy Giese, 1600 So. 59th St, 53214

Defendant William Edward Giese in court with attorney Jody Usow.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant William Edward Giese in court with attorney Jody Usow.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statements to the Court by Tracy G., the State, defense counsel and defendant.
Court sets Restitution at $379.26 - payable to Tracy G.  Address remains the same.
Restitution to be paid before payment of the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court instructs defendant to arrange payments with the probation agent.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant William Edward Giese in court with attorney Jody Usow.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #2 and #3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Additional statements by: Tracy G.

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #3), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

AS TO COUNT #3: Defendant sentenced to serve 3 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 75 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
   --- now attending. 
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
   --- Class done, can be repeated if appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Tracy G., without prior court approval.    
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with children.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
    --- cash bail to apply. 
* Restitution Hearing scheduled for Branch 4 on 7-1-2015 AT 1:30 PM.  
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-14-2015 AT 1:30 PM.  
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Defendant William Edward Giese in court.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 04.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/30/15 @ 1:30pm
